bestBHT.bht: We are so confident in our understanding of You, in Your knowledge of our hearts, and in Your divine origin, that we have no need to ask anything of You. By Your ability to read our thoughts, we recognize that You have come from God. This knowledge, that You possess all things, including the secrets of our hearts, strengthens our faith and deepens our belief in Your divine nature.

Henry Alford: Thou hast spoken so clearly of our feeling towards Thee, and of Thyself, that we have no occasion to ask Thee any thing."
We know therefore, by its being so, that Thou knowest the secrets of our hearts (all things by inference)."
Hence believe that Thou camest forth from God.
Albert Barnes: They were convinced that there was 'no need that any man should ask him,' or propose his difficulties to him, since he knew them all and could answer them.
It satisfied them that he knew the heart, and that he assuredly came from God.
They were convinced that he knew the heart, and that he assuredly came from God.
Marvin Vincent: We are sure [οιδαμεν] . Better, as Rev., we know.
By this [εν τουτω] . Literally, in this. Compare 1 John 2:3, 1 John 2:5; 1 John 3:16, 1 John 3:19, 1 John 3:24; 1 John 4:9, 1 John 4:10, 1 John 4:1 1 John 4:3, 1 John 4:17; 1 John 5:2.
Archibald T. Robertson: They had failed to understand the plain words of Jesus about going to the Father heretofore, but Jesus read their very thoughts and this fact seemed to open their minds to grasp his idea.
Should ask. Present active subjunctive with ινα in the original sense of asking a question.
In Christ's supernatural insight into their very hearts.
John Gill: they were fully assured that he must know all things
should Christ deliver anything not so intelligible to any of his audience, and they were desirous of knowing the sense of it, there would be no need of putting the question in form to him
this instance of Christ's omniscience was a strengthening proof of it
John Wesley: Thou knowest all things — Even our hearts.
Although no question is asked thee, yet thou answerest the thoughts of every one.
By this we believe that thou camest forth from God.
